creditline: Gift of Richard L. Simmons in memory of Roberta Grodberg Simmons
text: In Rajasthan, the mother of a newborn son traditionally wore a yellow veil known as a pido. Ten small lotus medallions symbolized the months of pregnancy and birth, while a large central lotus signaled the creation of a new life. Asking for a pido was a time-honored way for a wife to tell her husband she was expecting.
title: Maternal veil (Pido)
